findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract authorized users have the authority to stop the transactions for all users excluding the authorized users. The authorized users may take advantage of it by setting the `MaxTx` to zero or `MinTx` to the max `uint256` value.

findings.title: ELFM - Exceeds Fees Limit
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25%. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `changeBurnFee` function with a high percentage value.

findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop addresses from transactions. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `addBots` function.

findings.title: MSC - Missing Sanity Check
findings.description: The contract is processing variables that have not been properly sanitized and checked that they form the proper shape. These variables may produce vulnerability issues.

findings.title: RIS - Redundant If-Else Statement
findings.description: The contract has an if-else statement where the if branch doesn't contain any executable code. Hence, the if branch is redundant.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, leading to redundant storage writes and unnecessary gas consumption.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can lead to reduced readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
